title: Related_Content
description: Lists of content items or references this story is related to, arbitrarily keyed. In the Arc ecosystem, references in this object will be denormalized into the fully-inflated content objects they represent.

redirect.description: An attached redirect. In Arc, when this content item is fetched by url, content api will instead return this redirect object with appropriate headers.  In all other cases, this content should be treated normally.

trait_id.json.title: Globally Unique ID trait
trait_id.json.description: A globally unique identifier of the content in the ANS repository.

trait_version.json.title: Describes the ANS version of this object
trait_version.json.description: The version of ANS that this object was serialized as, in major.minor.patch format.  For top-level content objects, this is a required trait.

trait_owner.json.title: Owner information
trait_owner.json.description: Trait that applies information about the owner (typically a news organization) to a document.

owner.description: Information about the owner of this content.

id.description: The unique identifier for this owner. In the Arc ecosystem, this is often used to store the organization id.

sponsored.description: Necessary for including/excluding advertorial and native content in search results, story card features.

trait_revision.json.title: Revision
trait_revision.json.description: Trait that applies revision information to a document. In the Arc ecosystem, many of these fields are populated in stories by the Story API.

revision_id.description: The unique id of this revision.

parent_id.description: The unique id of the revision that this revisions was branched from, or preceded it on the current branch.

branch.description: The name of the branch this revision was created on.

editions.description: A list of identifiers of editions that point to this revision.

user_id.description: The unique user id of the person who created this revision.

published.description: Whether or not this revision's parent story is published, in any form or place

trait_additional_properties.json.title: Has additional properties
trait_additional_properties.json.description: A grab-bag object for non-validatable data.

trait_canonical_url.json.title: Canonical URL
trait_canonical_url.json.description: The fully qualified URL to the story. In the Arc ecosystem, this will be populated by the content api from the arc-canonical-url service if present.

..\\content.json.title: A content object.
..\\content.json.description: Holds common attributes of ANS Content objects.

trait_subtype.json.title: Subtype trait
trait_subtype.json.description: A more granular type than story, gallery, etc. (E.g., column, blog_post)

trait_channel.json.title: Channel trait
trait_channel.json.description: An optional list of output types for which this element should be visible

trait_alignment.json.title: Alignment
trait_alignment.json.description: A property used to determine horizontal positioning of a content element relative to the elements that immediately follow it in the element sequence.

trait_locale.json.title: Describes language for an element
trait_locale.json.description: The primary language of the content. The value should follow IETF BCP47. (e.g. 'en', 'es-419', etc.)

trait_short_url.json.title: Short_Url
trait_short_url.json.description: A url-shortened version of the canonical url.

trait_created_date.json.title: Created Date
trait_created_date.json.description: When the content was originally created (RFC3339-formatted). In the Arc ecosystem, this will be automatically generated for stories in the Story API.

trait_last_updated_date.json.title: Last Updated Date
trait_last_updated_date.json.description: When the content was last updated (RFC3339-formatted).

trait_first_publish_date.json.title: First Publish Date
trait_first_publish_date.json.description: When the story was first published.

trait_display_date.json.title: Display_Date
trait_display_date.json.description: The RFC3339-formatted dated time of the most recent date the story was (re)displayed on a public site.

trait_location.json.title: Location related trait
trait_location.json.description: A description of the location, useful if a full address or lat/long specification is overkill.

trait_geo.json.title: Geo
trait_geo.json.description: Latitidue and Longitude of the content

trait_address.json.title: Address
trait_address.json.description: An Address following the convention of http://microformats.org/wiki/hcard

trait_editor_note.json.title: Editor_Note
trait_editor_note.json.description: Additional information to be displayed near the content from the editor.

trait_status.json.title: Status
trait_status.json.description: Optional field to story story workflow related status (e.g. published/embargoed/etc)

trait_headlines.json.title: Headlines
trait_headlines.json.description: The headline(s) or title for this content.  The 'basic' key is required.

trait_description.json.title: Description
trait_description.json.description: The descriptions, or blurbs, for the content.

trait_credits.json.title: Credit trait
trait_credits.json.description: A list of people and groups attributed to this content, keyed by type of contribution. In the Arc ecosystem, references in this list will be denormalized into author objects from the arc-author-service.

..\\utils\\author.json.title: An author of a piece of content.
..\\utils\\author.json.description: Models attribution to an individual or group for contribution towards some content item. In the Arc ecosystem, these are stored in the arc-author-service.

type.description: Indicates that this is an author

org.description: The name of the organization the contributor belongs to.

bio.description: A description/short bio of the contributor.

url.description: A url to some deeper set of information about the contributor.

..\\image.json.title: An image.
..\\image.json.description: Holds attributes of an ANS image component. In the Arc ecosystem, these are stored in Anglerfish.

licensable.description: True if the image can legally be licensed to others.

trait_taxonomy.json.title: Taxonomy
trait_taxonomy.json.description: Holds the collection of tags, categories, keywords, etc that describe content.

keywords.description: A list of keywords. In the Arc ecosystem, this list is populated by Clavis.

named_entities.description: A list of named entities. In the Arc ecosystem, this list is populated by Clavis.

topics.description: A list of topics. In the Arc ecosystem, this list is populated by Clavis.

auxiliaries.description: A list of auxiliaries. In the Arc ecosystem, this list is populated by Clavis.

primary_site.description: A primary site object or reference to one. In the Arc ecosystem, a reference here is denormalized into a site from the arc-site-service.

sites.description: A list of site objects or references to them. In the Arc ecosystem, references in this list are denormalized into sites from the arc-site-service.

seo_keywords.description: A list of user-editable manually entered keywords for search purposes. In the Arc ecosystem, these can be generated and saved in source CMS systems, editors, etc.

stock_symbols.description: A list of stock symbols of companies related to this content. In the Arc ecosystem, these can be generated and saved in source CMS systems, editors, etc.

..\\utils\\keyword.json.title: Keyword
..\\utils\\keyword.json.description: Models a keyword used in describing a piece of content.

keyword.description: The keyword used to describe a piece of content

score.description: An arbitrary weighting to give the keyword

tag.description: The Part of Speech tag for this keyword.

frequency.description: An optional count of the frequency of the keyword as it appears in the content it describes

..\\utils\\named_entity.json.title: Named Entity
..\\utils\\named_entity.json.description: Models a named entity (i.e. name of a person, place, or organization) used in a piece of content.

_id.description: A unique identifier for the concept of the named entity.

name.description: The actual string of text that was identified as a named entity.

type.description: A description of what the named entity is. E.g. 'organization', 'person', or 'location'.

..\\utils\\topic.json.title: Topic
..\\utils\\topic.json.description: Models a topic used in describing a piece of content.

_id.description: The unique identifier for this topic.

name.description: The general name for this topic.

score.description: An arbitrary weighting to give the topic

uid.description: A short identifier for this topic. Usually used in cases where a long form id cannot work.

..\\utils\\auxiliary.json.title: Auxiliary
..\\utils\\auxiliary.json.description: Models a auxiliary used in targeting a piece of content.

_id.description: The unique identifier for this auxiliary.

name.description: The general name for this auxiliary.

uid.description: A short identifier for this auxiliary. Usually used in cases where a long form id cannot work.

..\\utils\\tag.json.title: Tag
..\\utils\\tag.json.description: Models a keyword used in describing a piece of content.

text.description: The text of the tag as displayed to users.

description.description: A more detailed description of the tag.

trait_slug.json.title: Slug
trait_slug.json.description: A short reference name for internal editorial use

..\\utils\\site.json.title: Site
..\\utils\\site.json.description: A hierarchical section or 'site' in a taxonomy. In the Arc ecosystem, these are stored in the arc-site-service.

description.description: A short description or tagline about this site

path.description: The url path to this site

parent_id.description: The id of this section's parent site, if any

..\\utils\\reference.json.title: Representation of a normalized element
..\\utils\\reference.json.description: This represents a reference to external content that should be denormalized

type.description: The ANS type that the provider should return.

service.description: The type of interaction the provider expects. E.g., 'oembed'

id.description: The id passed to the provider to retrieve an ANS document

provider.description: A URL that can resolve the id into an ANS element

referent_properties.description: An object for key-value pairs that should override the values of keys with the same name in the denormalized object

trait_promo_items.json.title: Promo Items
trait_promo_items.json.description: Lists of promotional content to use when highlighting the story. In the Arc ecosystem, references in these lists will be denormalized.

trait_planning.json.title: Scheduling information
trait_planning.json.description: Trait that applies planning information to a document or resource. In the Arc ecosystem, this data is generated by WebSked. Newsroom use only. All these fields should be available and editable in WebSked.

websked_sort_date.description: Date to be used for chronological sorting in WebSked.

deadline_miss.description: The delta between the story's planned publish date and actual first publish time, in minutes.

internal_note.title: Internal Note
internal_note.description: This note is used for shared communication inside the newsroom.

budget_line.title: Budget Line
budget_line.description: Used for the newsroom to identify what the story is about, especially if a user is unfamiliar with the slug of a story and the headline or they do not yet exist. Newsroom use only.

planned_publish_date.description: When the content is planned to be published.

scheduled_publish_date.description: When the content was first published.

word_count_planned.description: The anticipated number of words in the story.

inch_count_planned.description: The anticipated length of the story in inches.

inch_count_actual.description: The current length of the story in inches.

trait_workflow.json.title: Workflow information
trait_workflow.json.description: Trait that applies workflow information to a document or resource. In the Arc ecosystem, this data is generated by WebSked.

status_code.description: Code indicating the story's current workflow status. This number should match the values configured in WebSked.

note.description: This note will be used for any task automatically generated via WebSked task triggers.

trait_pitches.json.title: Pitches
trait_pitches.json.description: Trait that represents a story's pitches. In the Arc ecosystem, this data is generated by WebSked.

platform.description: A list of the story's pitches to a platform.

publication.description: A list of the story's pitches to a publication.

trait_platform_pitch.json.title: Platform pitch
trait_platform_pitch.json.description: Trait that represents a pitch to a platform. In the Arc ecosystem, this data is generated by WebSked.

platform_path.description: The path of the platform that this pitch targets.

trait_platform_pitch_event.json.title: Platform pitch event
trait_platform_pitch_event.json.description: Trait that represents an update event for a pitch to a platform. In the Arc ecosystem, this data is generated by WebSked.

status.description: The current status of the pitch.

user_id.description: The ID of the user who made this update.

note.description: Optional note associated with this update.

trait_publication_pitch.json.title: Publication pitch
trait_publication_pitch.json.description: Trait that represents a pitch to a publication. In the Arc ecosystem, this data is generated by WebSked.

publication_id.description: The ID of the publication that this pitch targets.

trait_publication_pitch_event.json.title: Publication pitch event
trait_publication_pitch_event.json.description: Trait that represents an update event for a pitch to a publication. In the Arc ecosystem, this data is generated by WebSked.

status.description: The current status of the pitch.

user_id.description: The ID of the user who made this update.

note.description: Optional note associated with this update.

edition_id.description: The ID of the publication edition that this pitch targets.

edition_time.description: The time of the publication edition that this pitch targets.

trait_syndication.json.title: Syndication
trait_syndication.json.description: Key-boolean pair of syndication services where this article may go

external_distribution.description: Necessary for fulfilling contractual agreements with third party Globe and Mail clients

search.description: Necessary so that we can filter out all articles that editorial has deemed should not be discoverable via search

trait_source.json.title: Source
trait_source.json.description: Information about the original source and/or owner of this content

source_type.description: The method used to enter this content. E.g. 'staff', 'wires'

name.description: The organization who originated this content.

system.description: The software (e.g., CMS) that was used to enter this content.

edit_url.description: A link to edit this content in its source CMS.

comments_period.description: How long (in days) after publish date until comments are closed.

allow_comments.description: If false, commenting is disabled on this content.

display_comments.description: If false, do not render comments on this content.

moderation_required.description: If true, comments must be moderator-approved before being displayed.

trait_label.json.title: Label
trait_label.json.description: What the Washington Post calls a Kicker

basic.description: The default label object for this piece of content.

url.description: An optional destination url of this label.

display.description: If false, this label should be hidden.

url.description: An optional destination url of this label.

display.description: If false, this label should be hidden.

trait_content_restrictions.json.title: Content Restrictions
trait_content_restrictions.json.description: Trait that applies contains the content restrictions of an ANS object.

content_code.description: The content restriction code/level/flag associated with the ANS object
